title: Intelligence Officials Urged Trump Spy Chief Not to Disclose Unverified Russian Claims About Clinton
summary: Officials at CIA, NSA, Office of Director of National Intelligence warned disclosure to Congress would give credibility to Kremlin-backed material. WASHINGTON-President Trump's spy chief ignored urgings from senior U.S. officials not to release information about Russian intelligence material containing unverified allegations about Hillary Clinton and the 2016 election, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: New U.S. Coronavirus Infections Stand Above 40,000
summary: Total confirmed cases in the U.S. approach 7.2 million, while the death toll nears 206,000. Coronavirus infection rates in the U.S. remain elevated, and now that states are reopening schools and businesses, there is high demand for tests to monitor the pandemic's spread.

title: Debate Ratings: First Contest Draws 73.1 Million TV Viewers
summary: Audience of first debate between Trump and Biden was 13% lower than initial Trump-Clinton debate in 2016. About 73.1 million people watched Tuesday night's presidential debate between President Trump and former Vice President Joe Biden on TV, an unruly contest that prompted debate organizers to rethink their ground rules.

title: Justice Department Opens Ventilator Antitrust Probe Focused on Medtronic
summary: Investigation, which examines past acquisitions, follows allegations that industry consolidation contributed to shortage of lifesaving machines. The Justice Department is investigating whether acquisitions by Medtronic PLC limited competition in ventilator manufacturing, according to people familiar with the matter, an antitrust probe that emerged from complaints about device shortages during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Pre-Existing Condition Fiction
summary: Biden repeats the same false claims about ObamaCare that Democrats use every election.. Joe Biden claimed at Tuesday's debate that "100 million people who have pre-existing conditions" will lose insurance if the Trump Administration wins an Affordable Care Act case at the Supreme Court. Democrats have terrified voters with this fiction for years, and Republican confusion has helped keep the fear alive. So let's explain the reality one more time.

title: Pompeo and the Pope
summary: The secretary calls for 'bold moral witness' in dealing with China.. Mike Pompeo arrived in Rome Wednesday at a sensitive moment for the Roman Catholic Church. The Vatican is beginning talks to renew a controversial provisional agreement with China that expires Oct. 22. In a speech at a U.S. Embassy symposium on religious liberty, the Secretary of State said the world is a better place when the church exercises its "bold moral witness"-especially in dealing with regimes such as China.

title: Senator Warren Measures the Rope
summary: Trying to appease her on 'stakeholder capitalism' didn't work.. As progressives rampage through America's elite institutions, there's a common trend. Activists blast the institution as immoral, whether because of capitalism, racism or something else. Leaders of the institution, hoping to calm passions, concede the moral point. But instead of buying political absolution, they undermine their authority and give the left more ammunition to assail them.

title: Sex, Due Process and Amy Coney Barrett
summary: Three other appellate courts followed her 2019 Title IX opinion-a mark of her quality as a jurist.. Amy Coney Barrett's Supreme Court nomination likely will bring renewed attention to the issue of Title IX litigation filed by students accused of sexual misconduct on campus. As a judge on the Seventh U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals, Ms. Barrett wrote a 2019 decision that revolutionized how courts consider Title IX claims from accused students. Lawsuits in this area have multiplied since 2011 guidance from the Obama administration, which pressed universities to adopt biased procedures to favor accusers, hoping that doing so would increase reporting of campus allegations. Several other courts of appeals embraced Judge Barrett's standard, which now applies to claims in 22 states. Beyond its importance to Title IX law, the opinion speaks to Judge Barrett's quality as a jurist.

title: Europe Fails to Contain Turkey
summary: As Erdogan's ambitions grow, Europe lacks the unity and strength to defend the continent's interests.. Brussels

title: Leave No Country Behind in the Post-Covid Recovery
summary: The pandemic may deepen global poverty and stifle trade and investment.. Developing economies face a decade of stagnation. Their plight poses dangers for the U.S. and the world. During the global financial crisis a decade ago, emerging markets supplied a supportive engine of growth. This time they might throw recovery into reverse.

title: 'Will You Shut Up, Man?'
summary: Amazing that just five words from the debate may tip voters who are undecided between Joe Biden and Donald Trump.. A reader emailed me before dawn Wednesday to say that in more than 60 years of presidential debates, he had never seen anything like what happened hours earlier. Yes, it's true, we're still in Trump Land, Toto.

title: Notable & Quotable: Peace in the Streets?
summary: 'A Joe Biden Presidency Will Require Mass Protests, Too'. Karol Markowitz writing for the Washington Examiner, Sept. 24:

title: 'The Jefferson Bible' Review: The Gospel, Sans Miracles
summary: In excising the miracles from the Christian gospels, did Thomas Jefferson remove the very thing he needed most?. However else he is known, Thomas Jefferson ought to be remembered as the great American prophet, the founder of a new nation and apostle of its faith. In "The Life and Morals of Jesus of Nazareth," his scrapbook of New Testament excerpts, the third president offered a dramatic revision of Christian tradition. The New Testament presented "the most sublime and benevolent code of morals which has ever been offered to man," he recognized, even if he hoped to sharpen those qualities by means of redaction. Recycling select passages from the Gospels, he included their ethical content but omitted any reference to the supernatural and presented the Messiah less as savior than as savant.

title: Biden Unveils Ethics Rules for Transition Staff
summary: The plan seeks to limit the influence of lobbyists while the transition team prepares for a possible Biden administration. WASHINGTON-Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden unveiled new ethics rules to limit the number of registered lobbyists on his transition team, part of an effort to avoid conflicts of interest as the team begins planning for a possible Biden presidency.

title: Coney Barrett Says Trump Quickly Offered Her Supreme Court Nomination
summary: Timeline laid out in questionnaire indicates there was little White House uncertainty in making pick. WASHINGTON-Supreme Court nominee Amy Coney Barrett disclosed that President Trump had offered her the nomination just days after Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg died, a timeline that suggests the week of suspense before the pick was publicly revealed was largely for show.

title: New York City's Indoor Dining Reopens After Six-Month Shutdown
summary: Restaurants faced some challenges but were hopeful as patrons returned to local favorites. When Grand Central Oyster Bar reopened Wednesday for the first time in six months, the restaurant was without its ace oyster shucker, who found work elsewhere during the pandemic shutdown. And it couldn't source the hot dog buns it once used for its beloved lobster rolls.

title: Fed Caps Big Banks' Dividends, Halts Share Buybacks in Fourth Quarter
summary: Central bank extends restrictions on dividends, buybacks, amid cloudy economic outlook. WASHINGTON-The biggest U.S. banks will face restrictions on dividends and share buybacks for another three months, the Federal Reserve said Wednesday, citing the need to conserve capital during the coronavirus-induced downturn.

title: Allstate to Lay Off 3,800 Employees
summary: Layoffs represent about 8% of the insurer's approximately 46,000 workers. Allstate Corp., one of the U.S.'s largest home and car insurers, announced Wednesday that it plans to lay off 3,800 employees in claims, sales and support roles.

title: State Sues New York Sports Clubs Owner Over Fees for Closed Gyms
summary: New York attorney general takes Town Sports to court after investigating its billing practices during the coronavirus pandemic. New York's attorney general is suing the parent of New York Sports Clubs and Lucille Roberts gyms for allegedly taking advantage of customers by illegally charging them monthly fees despite coronavirus-related closures.

title: FAA Chief Gives Thumbs-Up to 737 MAX Fixes
summary: Federal aviation chief personally flew Boeing's troubled aircraft to test fixes. Boeing Co. got a tentative personal endorsement for fixes to its beleaguered 737 MAX from the head of the Federal Aviation Administration after he personally took one of the jets on a test flight.

title: Value Stocks Are Outperforming Growth-at Least for Now
summary: Investors scooped up shares of beaten-down materials and transportation stocks in September. U.S. stocks just recorded their worst September performance in nearly a decade. For bargain-hunting investors who scooped up cheap stocks, however, the slump wasn't so bad.

title: As Covid-19 Cases Rise, Insurers Reduce Coverage for Virtual Doctors' Visits
summary: Complex rules are leading to confusion and charges that might cause patients to delay or avoid visits. Insurers are rolling back the terms of telehealth coverage they launched this spring, with some UnitedHealth Group Inc. and Anthem Inc. customers set to face out-of-pocket charges on certain virtual visits starting October 1.

title: Fierce Filmmaking Beyond Our Borders
summary: Martin Scorsese's World Cinema Project, in partnership with the Criterion Collection, has released its third boxed set of films from underrepresented parts of the globe..

title: Fighting Wildfires With Fire
summary: Native tribes once set fires to help keep forests in balance. After banning the practice, authorities are returning to it. On the morning of Sept. 8, residents of Happy Camp, Calif., on the traditional lands of the Karuk tribe near the Oregon border, woke up to see flames on a ridge above them. Within hours the fire had raced down the slope, engulfing 150 homes and killing two people. "It was chaos," said Bill Tripp, the Karuks' director of natural resources. "People were evacuating through the flames."

title: Going, Going, Guston
summary: The decision to postpone a much-anticipated retrospective was a surprise-and a mistake.. Before the lockdown, one of the most eagerly awaited events of the summer cultural season had been the Philip Guston retrospective at the National Gallery of Art in Washington. Guston (1913-1980) made his name as an Abstract Expressionist, but in the 1960s turned to representation. Though the move was seen in avant-garde circles as pure apostasy, the resulting work had a profound impact on younger painters, contributing significantly to the wholesale embrace of recognizable imagery in the 1980s and after. The retrospective, then, looked to be that rare thing, a celebration of a historical figure with contemporary relevance, moreover one whose achievements are still being debated.

title: The Making of Queen's Stadium Anthem 'We Will Rock You'
summary: Resume Subscription. Eager to engage concertgoers at large venues, Queen recorded an audience-participation song for its sixth studio album, "News of the World."

title: Judge Extends Shield Protecting Purdue's Sacklers From Lawsuits
summary: Injunction shielding members of the Sackler family continues until March; judge says move will facilitate talks over possible multibillion-dollar settlement. A bankruptcy judge has extended until next year a shield that protects Purdue Pharma LP's owners from litigation, saying the buffer is needed to facilitate negotiations with states on a potential multibillion-dollar settlement over the opioid crisis.

title: Justice Department Charges Hundreds with Medical Fraud
summary: Prosecutors allege more than $6 billion in fraudulent insurance charges for telemedicine and addiction treatment. WASHINGTON-More than 300 people were charged with bilking insurance providers of more than $6 billion in a federal sweep of alleged fraud involving the misuse of telemedicine, drug-treatment facilities and prescription opioids, authorities said Wednesday.

title: These Stocks Have Rallied More Than 400% This Year
summary: Resume Subscription. The stock market's star performers are shining brighter than ever and creating a stark divide with the rest of the pack.

title: Creator of Latin America's Most Beloved Comic, Mafalda, Dies
summary: A reflection of Argentine society, Quino's comic strip about an irreverent and curious girl became a Latin American icon. Argentine cartoonist Quino, creator of Mafalda, Latin America's most beloved comic strip about an irreverent and inquisitive middle-class girl who spoke for a generation of Latin Americans from the mid-1960s onward, died on Wednesday aged 88, his publisher said.

title: NextEra, Renewable-Energy Giant, Seeks Greater Scale With a Duke Takeover
summary: Duke Energy recently rebuffed an approach for an estimated $60 billion deal from NextEra, which is said to remain interested. NextEra Energy Inc.'s pursuit of Duke Energy Corp. could result in a merger of utility giants that could speed the renewable-energy transition throughout the South and Midwest.

title: Bayer to Cut More Costs as Farm Business Hurts
summary: Pandemic-induced demand drop is latest blow for company's ill-fated Monsanto acquisition. BERLIN- Bayer AG unveiled on Wednesday billions in new costs cuts to offset falling demand in agricultural products-the market on which it had made a huge bet with its acquisition of Monsanto.

title: Blank-Check Companies Get the ETF Treatment
summary: The Defiance NextGen SPAC Derived ETF is expected to start trading Thursday. Blank-check companies are getting their own exchange-traded fund.

title: FASB Further Delays Accounting Rule on Insurance Contracts
summary: Insurers get another year to prepare for changes in measuring value of long-term obligations. Insurance companies are getting even more time to implement a new rule for valuing long-term contracts following a vote by the Financial Accounting Standards Board on Wednesday.

title: Suspect Charged in Shooting of Los Angeles Sheriff's Deputies
summary: Deonte Lee Murray is charged with attempted murder for attack on two officers who were sitting in their patrol car. A 36-year-old man was charged Wednesday with attempted murder in the shooting of two Los Angeles Sheriff's deputies.

title: Stocks Finish Second Straight Quarter of Big Gains
summary: Market's run extended a historic recovery that few predicted in the depths of the March downturn. U.S. stocks turned in a second consecutive quarter of dramatic gains, continuing a historic stock-market recovery that few predicted in the depths of the March downturn.

title: Disney's Parks Can't Stand on Pandemic's Middle Ground
summary: Layoffs are the latest indication that real recovery is unlikely before a vaccine. Even given its sunny locales, Walt Disney 's theme-park business looks in for a long winter.

title: Google Unveils 5G Pixel Phones, Nest Audio Smart Speaker and First Chromecast With Remote
summary: Google annual hardware update focuses on affordable mobile and smart-home gadgets with AI-powered features. Google announced a new generation of mobile and smart-home products on Wednesday including two 5G-capable Pixel smartphones, the rebranded flagship smart speaker Nest Audio and the first Chromecast streaming-media player to come with a remote control. The player will be the first to feature a redesigned on-screen interface branded Google TV.

title: Mother of Three Killed by Stray Bullet in Queens Home
summary: Fatal shooting comes as New York City has seen a surge in violent crime since June. A mother of three was killed in her home in Queens early Wednesday morning when a stray bullet passed through her bedroom window and struck her, New York Police Department officials said.

title: Cheer Up, America
summary: Politicians are bound to disappoint, but life is getting better.. Between President Donald Trump's constant annoying interruptions and former Vice President Joe Biden's constant dishonest insults, Tuesday night's debate was hard to watch. Lucky for the president he has a record to run on and doesn't have to rely on personal popularity. Lucky for all of us, there's much good news to appreciate beyond the debate stage.

title: Why Maine Is the Perfect Road-Trip Destination for Fall
summary: Lobsters, treasure hunts and really low Covid-19 numbers. This 3-day getaway up the coast of southern Maine is the ideal antidote to cabin fever.. A SIGN in the window of an ice cream store in Bar Harbor, Maine, advises people to stand a moose apart. It must have helped. Maine has maintained some of the lowest Covid-19 numbers in the country. Stringent travel restrictions played a part too: In early April, the land of blueberry pies and L.L. Bean rolled up the welcome mat, mandating a two-week quarantine for all arrivals. The reins slightly loosened over the summer, letting visitors skip the quarantine by taking a Covid test. Luckier still are travelers from the six East Coast states-including New York and New Jersey-who are now exempt from both the Covid test and quarantine. Even so, tourism is half of what it was last year, which presents a clear upside to autumn roadtrippers: No more leaf-peeping logjams. For a primer on rusticating in southern Maine, head due north on Route 1 and follow this three-day itinerary:

title: Lake Homes That Give 'Après Ski' New Meaning
summary: Rather than buying luxury properties in the heart of a ski-resort town, some vacation homeowners are opting for lakefront properties near the mountains that they can enjoy all year. When they were growing up, Kathy Bagley's children spent winters skiing at their vacation home. They also spent summers skiing at their vacation home.

title: Trump Rolls the Dice in a Big Debate Gamble
summary: President tried to show that he is stronger than Joe Biden, but bullying may not attract undecided voters. Donald Trump is a gambler, and not just because he once owned casinos. He ran one of the biggest gambles of his life in Tuesday night's presidential debate, and whether it pays off now is very uncertain.

title: Grand Jury Recordings in Breonna Taylor Case Delayed
summary: Judge gives Kentucky attorney general's office until noon Friday to deliver audio with witnesses' personal information redacted. A state judge allowed more time for the Kentucky attorney general's office to release the recording of the grand jury proceedings in the Breonna Taylor case.

title: Here's What You Should Know Before Asking for a Raise
summary: Being optimistic and able to emphasize your unique experience can help when negotiating with an employer during the pandemic. Asking for a raise or a new position may seem risky in today's uncertain job market, but many companies still have budgets for new hires and salary increases. Doing the legwork before asking can go a long way in helping you get what you want.

title: Court Approves $800 Million Las Vegas Shooting Settlement
summary: MGM Resorts and insurers to compensate 4,400 relatives and victims, settling dozens of lawsuits. LAS VEGAS-A court on Wednesday approved a total of $800 million in payouts from casino company MGM Resorts International Inc. and its insurers to more than 4,400 relatives and victims of the Las Vegas Strip shooting that was the deadliest in recent U.S. history.

title: New York City Boosts Covid-19 Enforcement Amid Case Surge
summary: Police and other city workers deploy to neighborhoods to promote use of face masks. Despite increased public-awareness campaigns, testing efforts and enforcement, the percentage of people testing positive for Covid-19 continued to rise in several New York City neighborhoods, prompting Gov. Andrew Cuomo to say that the city isn't doing enough to prevent the spread.

title: Offshore Online Gambling Site Seeks to Become Legal U.S. Operator
summary: Costa Rican sportsbook 5Dimes reaches agreement with federal prosecutors to end criminal investigation. A Costa Rica-based online sportsbook that illegally took bets from American customers for years has reached a nonprosecution agreement with the U.S. Justice Department, as the company attempts to move into the legal sports-betting market in the U.S.

title: College Common App Drops Question About Discipline
summary: Black applicants reported they were suspended or expelled more than twice as often as white applicants. The Common Application is scrapping a question that asks applicants to reveal whether they have been subject to disciplinary action in high school, aiming to eliminate what it says could be an obstacle for Black students considering college.

title: 'Gangs of London' Review: Varieties of Violence
summary: A ferocious series on AMC+ follows a crime family in the aftermath of its patriarch's confounding murder.. As Tolstoy never quite put it, happy families are all alike; each unhappy crime family on television is unhappy in its own way. One reason the Wallace clan of the ferocious "Gangs of London" is unhappy is that de facto godfather Finn Wallace (Colm Meaney) has been shot in the face. Another reason: It was a case of mistaken identity, a motiveless crime, thus casting everyone in the Wallace empire under the bumbershoot of suspicion.

title: Ski-In/Ski-Out Homes Keep It Slope-side
summary: Ski home-owners pine for properties with easy access to the slopes. There's near the mountain and then there's on the mountain, and ski-in/ski-out homes put you as close as you can go. "You can take your skis for a very short walk or click them on and you go out and you ski into the house," says Carol Dopkin, an agent with Engel & Völkers Aspen.

title: Copper Rises After Upbeat Chinese Economic Data
summary: China accounts for roughly half of global copper demand, making its manufacturing sector a primary driver of prices. Copper prices climbed Wednesday, advancing back toward a multiyear high hit in mid-September after data showed China's economic recovery is gathering momentum.

title: Oil Giant Total Pledges Renewable Power Push
summary: French company to increase investment in low-carbon energy. Total SA pledged to ramp up its spending on renewable energy and reduce its dependence on petroleum, the latest move by a major oil company toward cleaner power.

summary: Plus, Alec Baldwin's watch list, Netflix's 'Dick Johnson Is Dead,' a quasi-documentary about life and death, and other picks to add to your queue. title: This Was the Debate From Hell
summary: Trump and Biden both sought a clear win and didn't get one, but Trump needed it more.. Well, that was different-really different. We've never seen anything quite like it. It was the least enlightening, edifying or elevating presidential debate in U.S. history.

title: House Committee Says U.S. Spy Agencies Are Failing China Challenge
summary: Committee report is part of a growing Capitol Hill consensus on confronting Beijing. WASHINGTON-A House Intelligence Committee report concludes that U.S. spy agencies are failing to meet the multipronged challenge posed by China and calls for changes to focus on pandemics, trade and other issues often given less attention by intelligence professionals.

title: Volkswagen Tries to Change Workplace Culture That Fueled Emissions Scandal
summary: A whistleblower hotline and compliance officers in each division are among ways the German car maker is improving its compliance culture. Volkswagen AG is betting that a reformed compliance culture and an expanded whistleblower program that helped the German car maker clear a critical U.S. regulatory milestone this month will also help prevent another scandal and go a long way in restoring its reputation.

title: Here's How Harvard Business School Plans to Advance Racial Equality
summary: The school has acknowledged past missteps involving race and said it would recruit more Black students and faculty. In an effort to promote racial equality, Harvard Business School said it would boost its enrollment of Black students in future classes, hire a chief diversity officer and recruit more Black faculty and staff. The school plans to build more issues of race and diversity into its case-study method of teaching and make conversations about race a higher priority in its curriculum, it said last week.

title: How Could the NFL's Covid-19 Outbreak Affect the Season?
summary: The league postponed Sunday's Titans-Steelers game after multiple Tennessee players tested positive for coronavirus; billions of dollars are at stake for league, TV networks. The National Football League is dealing with its first coronavirus outbreak. The league has postponed Sunday's game between the Tennessee Titans and Pittsburgh Steelers after multiple Titans players tested positive for Covid-19.

title: Biden: Catholic and Presidential Candidate
summary: I think it is shameful to use the body of Christ to make a cheap political attack on Joe Biden, an honest, decent, Christian, Catholic man.. I think it is shameful to use the body of Christ to make a cheap political attack on Joe Biden, an honest, decent, Christian, Catholic man ("Biden's Faith Meets a Polarized Electorate," Page One, Sept. 25). "And why do you look at the speck in your brother's eye, and do not consider the plank in your own eye?" (Matthew 7:3).

title: Two Cities and Religion Separate From State
summary: In the West, there has always been a belief that there are two kingdoms, described by St. Augustine as the city of God and the city of man.. I am a Protestant and would be the first to say "Amen" to Dominic Green's statement that Western "notions of free conscience and other sacred rights emerged from Protestants' struggle for religious freedom" ("Everybody Expects the Anti-Catholic Inquisition," op-ed, Sept. 28). However, in the West, there has always been a belief that there are two kingdoms, described by St. Augustine as the city of God and the city of man. This conviction has existed since Jesus first said, "Render to Caesar the things that are Caesar's; and to God the things that are God's" (Matthew 22:21).

title: Conditional Citizens? That Is a Very Jaundiced View
summary: The U.S., while definitely not perfect, is one of the least racist countries in the world.. My view couldn't be more different than the one expressed in Laila Lalami's book "Conditional Citizens," reviewed by Tunku Varadarajan (Books, Sept. 19). As a child, I met students who came to Mombasa, Kenya, as part of JFK's Peace Corps. I was impressed by the openness of the young, white Americans to us, people of color, and was amazed that they bothered to learn to sing songs in our native Swahili-it was so different from my experiences with our British colonial masters. This was my first contact with the soul of America, and it was probably at that time, age 13 or 14, that I knew where I was going.

title: Postal-Ballot Issues Will Hit State, Local Elections
summary: If the state supreme courts or the U.S. Supreme Court start throwing out ballots because president Trump or Joe Biden claim fraud, then what happens to all the down-ballot races?. Regarding your editorial "Will a 'Blue Shift' Swing Wisconsin?" (Sept. 23) about the election being stolen by Republicans or Democrats, and votes not being counted whether they are postmarked or received by Election Day.

title: On Mere Boasting vs. Lying
summary: Andy Kessler calls "Dizzy" Dean's frequently invoked line: "'It ain't braggin' if you can back it up'" "fair enough.". Andy Kessler calls "Dizzy" Dean's frequently invoked line: "'It ain't braggin' if you can back it up'" "fair enough" (Inside View, Sept. 28). Actually, that is the very definition of bragging. If you can't back it up, you're not bragging-you're lying.

title: Facebook Links Instagram and Messenger

title: Joe Biden's ObamaCare Tax Avoidance
summary: In 2019 he and his wife legally dodged payroll levies on $228,703 in income.. title: The Trump-Biden Stakes: Your Life Savings
summary: Millions of Americans have 401(k)s, making high stock values a boon for Main Street-even in Scranton.. Then he added, crucially: "It also means 401(k)s." That point hits home among the millions of Americans with savings in a tax-advantaged investment vehicle, who watched their retirement funds rise in the prepandemic stock surge.

title: Utility Megadeal Looks Unlikely and Unappetizing
summary: NextEra Energy would have to jump through a series of hoops to buy Duke Energy, and the resulting deal might not even look that attractive. Utility stocks tend to move in a tight band, but Duke Energy 's shares surged 7% early Wednesday after The Wall Street Journal reported that NextEra Energy , the largest utility in the U.S., made a takeover approach. The enthusiasm looks premature.

title: Rolls-Royce's $400,000 Attempt at a Low-Key, 'Minimalist' Sedan
summary: To avoid the stigma luxury carries in Covid times, Roll-Royce is trying to rebrand as 'post-opulent.' The new Ghost isn't the best argument, says Dan Neil.. THE NEW Rolls-Royce Ghost debuts a number of technical innovations-a unique double-damped front suspension, for example, adding more float to the boat-but its greatest invention is surely the marketing team's notion of "post-opulence." The suggestion from HQ being that, compared with the first-generation Ghost (2009-2020), the new car's presentation is more restrained, less flashy, even "minimalist."

title: Trump and Biden's First Debate: The Moments That Mattered
summary: Candidates clash in heated exchanges over health care, Supreme Court, coronavirus and racial protests; 'Will you shut up, man?'. After months of distanced sniping, President Trump and former Vice President Joe Biden took to the debate stage for a 90-minute clash animated by fresh news developments, personal insults and an enduring pandemic.

title: From SZA to Springsteen, the Best Songs You Should Be Listening to Right Now
summary: WSJ.'s monthly roundup of new pop releases: everything that's grabbing our attention, making us think or getting us dancing. Find this latest playlist and more on our Spotify page. "Hit Different," by SZA, featuring Ty Dolla $ign

title: Why Hospitals Can't Handle Covid Surges: They're Flying Blind
summary: During a pandemic, officials need real-time data to make sure resources go where they're needed; attempts to build a system this year have failed. El Centro Regional Medical Center was overrun with dozens of Covid-19 patients in May, with nowhere to send the critically ill. The only other hospital in Imperial County, Calif., also was swamped.

title: Indian Court Acquits Hindu Nationalists Accused in 1992 Mosque Demolition
summary: The destruction of the Babri mosque was a pivotal moment in a Hindu-nationalist movement that is ascendant under Prime Minister Modi. NEW DELHI-An Indian court on Wednesday acquitted more than two dozen senior Hindu-nationalist politicians and activists accused of orchestrating the destruction in 1992 of a controversial mosque in the northern Indian town of Ayodhya that sparked riots across the country.

title: Container Shipping Line CMA CGM Says Data Possibly Stolen in Cyberattack
summary: The global operator tells clients the malware hit is being contained and operations are gradually returning to normal. CMA CGM SA said some of its data may have been stolen after a malware attack that forced the global container line to shut down its main booking platform, delay cargo deliveries and halt electronic communications with clients and customs authorities.

title: Buffett, Buffett and the Buffet
summary: Cheeseburger in Paradise, the chain once owned by Jimmy Buffett's holding company, shut its doors eight years after the singer cashed out. Although one has been known to play the ukulele and the other to shrewdly invest his musical royalties, it is hard to confuse Warren Buffett with Jimmy Buffett.

title: 'Mushrooms Have Kidnapped You': Pandemic Feeds Russia's Obsession With Forest Fungi
summary: With lots of down time and a bountiful harvest, mushrooming mushrooms in forests around Moscow and St. Petersburg. For many people around the world, the coronavirus pandemic has been an excuse to learn a homey new skill like knitting or pastry-making.

title: Pompeo Calls On Pope Francis to Defend Religious Freedom in China
summary: Tensions between Washington and the Vatican over China policy dominate Secretary of State Mike Pompeo's visit to Rome. ROME-Secretary of State Mike Pompeo launched a strong attack on religious persecution in China and called on the Vatican to stand up for religious freedom there, in an implicit criticism of Pope Francis's rapprochement with Beijing.

title: To Battle Covid, Airlines Bet on Disinfectants That Come With Questions
summary: U.S. carriers are using higher amounts of some chemicals to show their planes are safe-the unknown long-term effects of these antiviral sprays concern some scientists. Many airlines have suspended beverage service because of the pandemic, but they are serving a new brew in passenger cabins: multiple doses of disinfectants.

title: New York Hospital Chain Finds Coronavirus-Surge Clues in Web Traffic
summary: Northwell Health model uses data from first six months of pandemic in New York to predict next wave. In an effort to detect surges of Covid-19 patients earlier, before they arrive at an emergency room, one New York hospital system is turning to web-browsing traffic.

title: John Waters's Favorite American Road Trip Is Predictably Surprising
summary: We asked three notables-including the director, a BBQ chef and a peripatetic photographer-about their most unforgettable road journeys in the U.S.. Visiting the Tina Turner museum in Brownsville, Tenn., which I had no idea was there. I was going to Dollywood and Graceland, and it's in-between. It's kind of pitiful and in a little industrial park, not real grand, I promise you. It has her one-room schoolhouse from Nutbush, Tenn., which is nearby, a couple of her old costumes and no mention of Ike Turner at all. The two lovely women working there reminded me of people in the Liberace Museum, kind of like cult-member loyalists. They were so happy someone came in.

title: Renewable Energy Can Live With Trump or Biden
summary: Last four years have proven that the industry is past its formative years. Renewable energy stocks are flying high in the run-up to Election Day. That isn't necessarily a reflection of Joe Biden's perceived edge.

title: IT Chiefs Address Growing Set of Collaboration Problems Tied to Remote Work
summary: Companies focus on making remote work easier on their employees. Half a year into the coronavirus pandemic lockdown, information-technology leaders are tackling a new set of communication problems, as companies extend their remote-work infrastructure beyond business continuity and into employee well-being.

title: Silver Lake Launches New 25-Year Investment Strategy Backed by Mubadala
summary: Abu Dhabi fund's $2 billion contribution comes as buyout firm nears completion of new $18 billion-plus flagship fund. Abu Dhabi sovereign-wealth fund Mubadala Investment Co. is making an investment in Silver Lake and contributing $2 billion to help the technology-focused private-equity firm launch a new long-term strategy.

title: Palantir, Duke, Disney, Apple Stocks: What to Watch When the Market Opens Today
summary: The S&P 500 index is on track for its first monthly decline since March. Here's what we are watching as markets kick into gear Wednesday.

title: China's Yuan Is Riding High as Economy Recovers, Foreign Investors Pump In Money
summary: The Chinese currency is on track for its strongest quarter against the dollar since 2008. The yuan is closing out its strongest quarter against the dollar in more than a decade, boosted by optimism over China's economic outlook and by the country's comparatively high interest rates.

title: President Trump's Tax Deductions-and Yours
summary: Smart taxpayers should know the boundaries when taking deductions. President Trump is facing scrutiny for tax deductions that millions of Americans use, or would like to.

title: In 2020 Election, Florida Felon Voting Limits Could Sway State Outcome
summary: A Wall Street Journal analysis shows legal changes could block thousands from voting. As the election nears in hotly contested Florida, restrictions affecting felon voting rights could block thousands from casting ballots, potentially altering the state's outcome in the presidential race, according to a Wall Street Journal analysis.

title: New York City Companies Lure Subway-Wary Workers With Travel Stipends
summary: Discounted parking, Citi Bike memberships, Uber rides have been offered as alternatives to public transportation. Emilie Goldman, a commercial real-estate broker in New York City, rode the subway about eight times a day before the coronavirus pandemic. Now, she mainly splits her trips around town between Revel mopeds, Citi Bikes and Ubers, courtesy of her employer, startup SquareFoot Inc.

title: The Dollar Helped Fuel an 'Everything Rally'-But It Could Bite Back
summary: Some extreme investor positioning suggests the summer's weak dollar could rebound, to the detriment of stocks and commodities. What the U.S. dollar giveth, there is a risk that it taketh away.

title: Providence Equity's Nelson Plans to Shift Role as Firm Maps Out Transition
summary: The media and information services-focused buyout firm is promoting five of its senior professionals as Chief Executive Jonathan Nelson plans to become executive chairman in 2021. Jonathan Nelson, founder and chief executive of Providence Equity Partners, one of the private-equity industry's oldest sector-focused firms, is laying the groundwork for a new generation of leaders.

title: Shell to Cut Up to 9,000 Jobs
summary: Energy giant warns of another tough quarter as the pandemic continues to sap demand for oil. Royal Dutch Shell PLC said it would cut up to 9,000 jobs in a broad restructuring, as the energy giant grapples with the continuing fallout of the coronavirus pandemic.

title: China Evergrande Quells Cash-Crunch Worries With Investor Show of Support
summary: Owners of stakes in a subsidiary agree not to exercise their right to have the developer buy them back. HONG KONG-China's most-indebted property developer averted a near-term cash crunch, sending its shares and bonds sharply higher Wednesday, a surprising turnaround from less than a week ago.

title: Serena Williams Withdraws From French Open Due to Achilles Injury
summary: The 39-year-old tennis star says she will likely need four to six weeks of recovery. PARIS-There won't be a 24th Grand Slam singles title for Serena Williams in 2020 after all.

title: The Easiest, Riskiest, Most Controversial Shot in Tennis
summary: In the era of the baseliners, the humble underhand serve is seeing a resurgence. Paris

title: Currency Gyrations Spark Fresh Bets From Investors
summary: Foreign-exchange markets have had their most exciting time in years, creating opportunities for investors to profit. Swings in currencies have breathed life back into the foreign-exchange market, attracting investors who bet that some countries can outgrow others in the pandemic.

title: U.S. Refugee Backlog Swells, Leaving Families Waiting to Reunite
summary: As acceptances ebb to another record low, persecuted Pakistani Christian blogger hopes for spot in line. The U.S. has admitted just under 11,000 refugees during the fiscal year ending Wednesday, the smallest number in the refugee program's 40-year history, according to State Department data.

title: Axios Is Growing and Profitable Despite Bleak News Landscape
summary: Three-year-old media company avoids staff reductions and is on pace to be profitable in 2020. "Smart brevity" has been good for business at Axios.

title: At Calvin Klein and Tommy Hilfiger, New CEO Adapts to Shopping Now
summary: Stefan Larsson will be charged with guiding PVH out of the pandemic and into retailing's 'new normal'. PVH Corp. , the owner of Calvin Klein and Tommy Hilfiger, is switching chief executives in the middle of the coronavirus pandemic. Stefan Larsson, PVH's president since June 2019, will succeed Manny Chirico in the top job on Feb. 1. Mr. Chirico will remain chairman.

title: Store Landlords Face a Battle for a Cut of Online Sales
summary: Commercial landlords are increasingly exposed to the fluctuations in their tenants' day-to-day business. If retailers want leases that reflect modern shopping habits, should they hand over a cut of online sales to their landlords?

title: The Negative-Rate Debate Is Dying on the Vine
summary: Subzero policy rates are now so unattractive that the biggest economic shock in modern history couldn't drive central bankers to deploy them. From 2014 to 2016, central banks increasingly adopted negative interest rates in response to sliding inflation. At the time, economists and investors could reasonably wonder whether subzero monetary policy was the path of the future for the developed world.

title: Fed's Rosengren Worries About Risks to Lending From Prolonged Virus Threat
summary: 'People have taken too much comfort in how quickly the unemployment rate has fallen,' says the Boston Fed president. Boston Fed President Eric Rosengren said his outlook for the U.S. economy is more pessimistic than some of his colleagues because of his concerns that the persistence of the coronavirus pandemic will prevent a return to more normal levels of activity.

title: U.K., Canada Impose Sanctions on Belarusian President Lukashenko
summary: Measures targeting the leader and his allies in response to repression of peaceful election protests come as U.S., EU consider action. LONDON-The U.K. and Canada imposed sanctions on Belarus President Alexander Lukashenko and senior figures in his government, a sign of widening discontent in the West over ongoing repression of peaceful protests against his purported victory in a disputed election.

title: China's Influence on Deals in Europe Often Goes Unseen
summary: Chinese government shareholders wield undetected influence in hundreds of deals, new research finds. China's government has been deeply involved-often from behind the scenes-in a wave of acquisitions across Europe over the past decade.

title: House Democrats to Call for Big Tech Breakups
summary: Panel expected to recommend significant measures targeting power of large technology companies. WASHINGTON-Democratic lawmakers are expected to call on Congress to blunt the power of big technology companies, possibly through forced separation of online platforms, as a House panel concludes its Big Tech probe.

title: Fed's Low-Rate Strategy Confronts Concerns Over Bubbles
summary: Lack of consensus on how to handle possible asset bubbles could threaten the central bank's willingness to maintain its low-rate promises. Federal Reserve officials' promises to hold interest rates very low for a long time could pose a dilemma once the pandemic is over: how to deal with the risk of asset bubbles.

title: Colleges Use Targeted Lockdowns, Online Classes to Preserve Fall Semester
summary: Quarantines and short shifts to web instruction are last-ditch efforts before schools change course for the whole term. Providence College put itself on lockdown last month, barring students who live on campus from traveling into town and telling those who live off campus to shelter in place, using food delivery services. Classes moved online. Students could socialize only with their roommates.

title: Chris Wallace Strains to Control Debate as Trump Flouts Rules
summary: Fox anchor pleaded with president to allow Joe Biden the two-minute uninterrupted answers both sides had agreed to. Fox News anchor Chris Wallace was stuck between two clashing forces as moderator of Tuesday night's presidential debate: straightforward rules and a participant who seemed determined to ignore them.

title: China Greenlights Another Covid-19 Vaccine for Human Testing
summary: Chinese drugmaker Shenzhen Kangtai will test its vaccine on people after showing it protected mice and monkeys from coronavirus. A Chinese drugmaker, which is collaborating with AstraZeneca PLC on production of a coronavirus vaccine, has won approval from Chinese regulators to start testing one of its own vaccine candidates at home.

title: China's Economic Rebound Picks Up Pace
summary: Factory activity expanded strongly in September as the recovery in sector demand and production sped up. BEIJING-China's economy gathered more steam in September as a rebound in global demand and the government's supportive measures bolstered factory activity and helped push sentiment in the service sector to its highest level in nearly seven years.

title: A Depressing Debate Spectacle
summary: Pro wrestlers are more presidential than either man Tuesday night.. No one expected a Lincoln-Douglas debate, but did it have to be a World Wrestling Entertainment bout? Which may be unfair to the wrestlers, who are more presidential than either Donald Trump or Joe Biden sounded in their first debate Tuesday night.

title: Trump, Biden Clash in Contentious First Debate
summary: The two candidates constantly spoke over each other in exchanges more notable for rancor than policy nuance. WASHINGTON-President Trump and Joe Biden clashed over the Supreme Court, the coronavirus and the economy in a debate marked by interruptions and insults from both candidates Tuesday-with the Republican leader telling his rival that for "47 years you've done nothing" and the Democratic challenger calling Mr. Trump "the worst president that America has ever had."

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: For Black Working Women, Covid-19 Has Been a Heavy Burden
summary: The pandemic's fallout has made them much more likely than others to consider stepping away from their careers. Most women are facing challenges during Covid-19, from navigating their careers to balancing work and home responsibilities.

title: How the Coronavirus Crisis Threatens to Set Back Women's Careers
As Women Fight to Maintain Progress, Companies Need to Reimagine How They Operate
summary: Working women are under extra duress from the pandemic. Employers can help with a new commitment to flexibility and inclusion.. For years, American corporations tried to increase job flexibility with scant success. The pandemic ushered in more flexibility, along with added responsibilities and few boundaries. For women, who typically shoulder more duties at home regardless of their breadwinning status, that has felt less like freedom than pressure to be always on.

title: Sheryl Sandberg: Companies and Women Are at a Crossroads
summary: Next in Journal Reports: Leadership. A crisis is looming in corporate America: More than one in four women are considering downshifting their careers or leaving the workforce.

title: Judge Temporarily Blocks Immigration Fee Increases
summary: Most fee waivers for low-income immigrants would have been eliminated under changes. A federal court in San Francisco on Tuesday temporarily blocked the Trump administration from raising the cost of citizenship and other immigration applications, whose fees were set to increase at the end of the week.

title: Seven Airlines Close Billions of Dollars in Loans With Treasury
summary: Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin urges Congress to approve more aid for airline workers. The U.S. Treasury said it has closed loans to seven passenger airlines and joined with the industry to call on Congress to extend more aid to prevent massive job cuts later this week.

title: Boeing to Move All 787 Dreamliner Production to South Carolina
summary: Shift would end output of that jetliner in Seattle area as demand for planes plummets amid pandemic. Boeing Co. will set plans this week to consolidate 787 Dreamliner assembly in South Carolina, people familiar with the matter said, ending production of that jetliner in Washington state as the coronavirus pandemic saps demand for aircraft.

title: Senator Questions Drugmaker Purdue's Bankruptcy Venue Choice
summary: Sen. Tammy Baldwin seeks information about Purdue's connection to White Plains, N.Y., a popular bankruptcy venue where the OxyContin manufacturer sought chapter 11 protection. A Democratic Senator wants information about a decision by the maker of OxyContin to file for bankruptcy in a New York City suburb known as a popular landing spot for large corporate restructurings because of the single judge overseeing chapter 11 cases there.

title: NextEra Energy Made Takeover Approach to Duke Energy
summary: Duke rebuffed the approach but NextEra is still interested in pursuing a deal, people familiar with the matter said. NextEra Energy Inc. recently made a takeover approach to Duke Energy Corp., according to people familiar with the matter, testing the waters for what would be a $60 billion-plus combination of two Southern utilities.

title: Kroll Agrees to Pay $2 Million to Settle Allegations It Broke Credit-Ratings Rules
summary: SEC cites lack of 'analytical method' in how firm's analysts rated commercial mortgage-backed securities. Kroll Bond Rating Agency Inc. agreed to pay $2 million in a settlement with the Securities and Exchange Commission for violating rules designed to make credit ratings accurate.

title: Pelosi and Mnuchin Make Late Push for Possible Coronavirus Aid
summary: Two officials will resume talks Wednesday despite skepticism on Capitol Hill that deal is possible at this stage. WASHINGTON-House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D., Calif.) and Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin are making a late push to try to reach a coronavirus-relief deal before the election, despite skepticism on Capitol Hill that an agreement is possible at this stage.
